newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil August inflation at 0.34 pct - Fipe.
newsitem.headline: Brazil August inflation at 0.34 pct - Fipe.

text.p: Brazil's inflation as measured by the Economic Research Institute (Fipe) was 0.34 percent for the month of August, down from 1.31 percent in July, a Fipe official said.
August inflation was the lowest monthly rate since March, when Fipe inflation was 0.23 percent.
Juarez Rizzieri, president of the Fipe institute, said a drop in clothing prices and transportation costs led inflation to slow in August.
He also said he predicts September inflation around 0.5 percent.
The Fipe institute also announced the following breakdown of its weighted inflation index for August:
- Food -0.29 pct drop in the period
- Housing 2.11 pct rise in the period
- Transportation -0.27 pct drop in the period
- Personal expenses 0.36 pct rise in the period
- Clothing -2.26 pct drop in the period
- Health care 1.53 pct rise in the period
- Education -0.25 pct drop in the period
The Fipe index is calculated by the University of Sao Paulo, which releases inflation figures at weekly intervals.
